intro: Uragoga thonneri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. Uragoga thonneri thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
